Class ClearRow

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.util.ClearRow
public final class ClearRow extends Object
Immutable data class containing information about a row clearing operation.

This class encapsulates the results of clearing completed rows from the board, including the number of rows removed, the updated board matrix, and the score bonus earned.

The new matrix is returned as a defensive copy to prevent external modification.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Rajul Kabir

  • Constructor Details

    • ClearRow

      public ClearRow(int linesRemoved, int[][] newMatrix, int scoreBonus)
      Creates a new ClearRow object.
      Parameters:
      linesRemoved - The number of rows that were cleared
      newMatrix - The updated board matrix after clearing
      scoreBonus - The score bonus earned (calculated as 50 × lines²)

  • Method Details

    • getLinesRemoved

      public int getLinesRemoved()
      Gets the number of rows that were cleared.
      Returns:
      The number of completed rows removed (0-4)

    • getNewMatrix

      public int[][] getNewMatrix()
      Gets a copy of the updated board matrix.

      This matrix represents the board state after rows have been cleared and remaining blocks have been shifted down.

      Returns:
      A defensive copy of the updated board matrix

    • getScoreBonus

      public int getScoreBonus()
      Gets the score bonus earned for clearing these rows.

      The bonus is calculated as 50 × (lines cleared)².

      Returns:
      The score bonus points
